description: Variation of condition 23 (Accessible and Adaptable Dwellings) of planning permission ref: PP/2015/3558 dated 09/12/2016 for 'Demolition of existing buildings (including 73 residential dwellings, 39sq.m floorspace in A1 use class, and 79sq.m floorspace in D1 use class) and construction of 246 new dwellings (81 x 1-bed, 100 x 2-bed, 56 x 3-bed and 9 x 4-bed) in buildings between two and nine-storeys high with associated private and semi-private amenity space; on and off-street car parking (124 spaces), cycle parking storage facilities; refuse / recycling storage facilities; communal energy centre (for Phase 7.1); alterations to Church Road, Ragley Close, Telfer Close and Oldham Terrace; reconfiguration and part re-development of Avenue Road Public Open Space and associated ancillary works (Departure from the Local Plan).' Variation proposes to change the condition to 'The Approved residential development shall be designed and constructed to meet Approved Document M (Volume 1: Dwellings), Part M4(2) (Accessible and adaptable dwellings of Building Regulations 2015, or other such relevant technical requirements in use at the time of the construction of the development, with the exception of Block E2.'
decision_conditions: The development permitted has already commenced in accordance with Section 56 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:

Air Quality Assessment Report No: J2237/1F1 dated 14.07.2015 prepared by Air Quality Consultants; Arboricultural Report and Tree Condition Survey ref: 1214 17841 dated July 2015 prpared by Ruskins Group Consultancy; Construction Method Statement and Construction Management Plan prepared by Countryside Properties; Daylight and Sunlight Report dated 14.07.2015 prepared by GL Hearn; Design and Access Statement July 2015 prepared by Stitch; Energy Statement Issue 02 ref: J2059 dated 15/07/2015 prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd; Environmental Noise Assessment report no: SRB/6839/A dated 13.07.2015 prepared by AIRO Ltd; Flood Risk Assessment Rev F1 ref: A2811/July 2015 prepared by CTP; Foul and Surface Water Drainage Statement ref: A2811/September 2015 Rev F2 dated 18/09/2015 prepared by CTP; Framework Travel Plan ref: PH/PR/ITB10202-004 R dated 16.07.2015 prepared by i-Transport LLP; Ground Conditions Desk Based Assessment ref: GE10451/DSR/APR15v1 prepared by Geo-Environmental; Landscape Design Statement Version C dated 14.07.2015 and drawings ref: LD-PLN-001 C, LD-PLN-002 C, LD-PLN-003 C, prepared by LUC; Landscape and Visual Appraisal ref: 180603G dated 14.07.2015 prepared by Terence O'Rourke; Planning Supporting Statement  ref; 180603G (inc. Affordable Housing Statement, Estate Management Strategy and Heritage Statement) prepared by Terence O'Rourke; Phase 1 Habitat Survey ref: LON-136-002 dated July 2015 prepared by ASG Ecology; Statement of Community Involvement July 2015, prepared by Acton Gardens LLP; Transport Assessment ref: PH/PR/ITB10202-003A R dated 16.07.2015 prepared by i-Transport; Water Statement ref: J2059 dated 14.07.2015 prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd; ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: Energy Statement Addendum Issue 01 ref: J2059 dated 01.10.2015 prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd; Framework Travel Plan ref: PH/PR/ITB10202-004B R dated 23.09.2015 and drawings ITB10202-GA-01 A, ITB10202-GA-02, ITB10202-GA-003, ITB10202-GA-04, prepared by i-Transport LLP; Road Safety Audit - Stage 1 Ref: 0483 Acton Phase 7.1 RSA1 dated 14.09.2015 prepared by Badingham Transport & Infrastructure Consultants.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Development shall be carried out in accordance with the details contained within the approved Construction Method Statement and Construction Management Plan prepared by Countryside Properties and the approved Air Quality Assessment Report No: J2237/1F1 dated 14.07.2015 prepared by Air Quality Consultants,and including the preparation and implementation of a Dust Management Plan specified in both approved documents.

Prior to the commencement of any site work, all sensitive properties within or surrounding the site shall be notified in writing of the nature and duration of the works to be undertaken, and the name and address of a responsible person to whom enquiries / complaints should be directed. These details shall also be displayed at regular intervals around the site compound. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved details.

Reason:  To ensure that appropriate mitigation measures are put in place to protect the amenity of local residents that live in close proximity to the demolition and construction site and to ensure adequate highway and site safety, in accordance with policies 5.3, 5.18, 6.3, 7.14, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2016); policies 1.1(e), 1.1(f) and 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); (Interim) SPG 10: Noise and Vibration; the National Planning Policy Framework (2012); the Greater London Authority SPG 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition' (2014), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.

| Development shall not commence (excluding demolition, site clearance and preparation works) until a piling risk assessment and method statement has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. The piling risk assessment should demonstrate that the chosen method of piling would not increase the risk of near-surface pollutants migrating into deeper geological formations and aquifers. The Piling Method Statement should include details of the type of piling to be undertaken and the methodology by which such piling would be carried out, including measures to prevent and minimise the potential for damage to subsurface water or sewage infrastructure. The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: Details of piling are required before the sub-structure works commence because Thames Water would require that any proposed piling methods do not pose a pollution risk to controlled waters, water or sewage infrastructure in accordance with policy 5.14 of the London Plan (2016) and policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012).

| Development shall not commence (excluding demolition, site clearance and preparation works) until a detailed surface water drainage scheme based on the agreed drainage attenuation systems detailed within the approved Foul and Surface Water Drainage Statement ref: A2811/September 2015 Rev F2 dated 18/09/2015 prepared by CTP, has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. The detailed surface water drainage scheme shall include the following information:

a)	A clearly labelled drainage layout plan showing pipe networks and any attenuation areas or storage locations. This plan should show any pipe 'node numbers' that have been referred to in network calculations and it should also show invert and cover levels of manholes;
b)	Confirmation of the critical storm duration;

c)	Where infiltration forms part of the proposed stormwater system such as infiltration trenches and soakaways, soakage test results and test locations are to be submitted in accordance with BRE digest 365;
d)	Where on site attenuation is achieved through ponds, swales, geocellular storage or other similar methods, calculations showing the volume of these are also required;
e)	Where an outfall discharge control device is to be used such as a hydrobrake or twin orifice, this should be shown on the plan with the rate of discharge stated;

f)	Calculations should demonstrate how the system operates during a 1 in 100 chance in any year critical duration storm event, including an allowance for climate change in line with the 'Planning Practice Guidance: Flood Risk and Coastal Change'. If overland flooding occurs in this event, a plan should also be submitted detailing the location of overland flow paths and the extent and depth of ponding;
g)	An exceedance route plan demonstrating methods to manage excess flows on-site from storm events in excess of 1 in 100 years (to minimise risk to people and property);
h)	A maintenance plan for the drainage system for the lifetime of the development and confirming the owners / adopters of the drainage system.

The approved surface water drainage scheme shall be implemented so that it is ready for use prior to the first occupation of the different areas of the development (noting that the delivery of the approved scheme will be phased), and subsequently maintained in accordance with the approved maintenance plan.

Reason: Details of the surface water scheme are required before sub-structure works commence because the Lead Local Floor Authority require the applicant to make provision within the construction programme and proposed development for adequate surface water drainage to reduce the risk of flooding to the proposed development and locality, and to enhance water quality and biodiversity, in accordance with the objectives of Section 11 of the NPPF; policies 5.12, 5.13 and 5.14 of the London Plan (2016); policy 1.2(m) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and policy LV5.12 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).

| No development shall commence until tree protection measures are put in place to protect trees identified for retention on drawings 0505-1785 TPP-01 Rev 1 Sheets 1 and 2 and set-out within the approved Arboricultural Report and Tree Condition Survey ref: 1214 17841 dated July 2015 prepared by Ruskins Group Consultancy. The tree protection measures shall be retained throughout the demolition of existing buildings and construction of the approved development, in accordance with the recommendations in BS5837 (2012).
Planning permission is only hereby granted for the removal of trees identified for removal on the aforementioned drawings and within the approved Arboricultural Report and Tree Condition Survey.
Reason: The protection of trees and other vegetation is required in accordance with policies 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016), and interim SPG 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'.

| Hard and soft landscaping, the equipped play areas and boundary treatments detailed within the approved Landscape Design Statement Version C dated 14.07.2015 and drawings ref: LD-PLN-001 C, LD-PLN-002 C, LD-PLN-003 C prepared by LUC, and the rainwater butts specified within the approved Water Statement ref: J2059 dated 14.07.2015 prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd, shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the dwellings to which the landscaping, equipped play areas and boundary treatments forms part.

All soft landscaping shall be carried out in the earliest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive). The quality of all approved landscape works shall be in accordance with British Standard 4428:1989 'Code of Practice for General Landscape Operations' or any subsequent revision.  All trees included within the approved scheme shall be healthy, well-formed specimens with single leading shoots and shall be of a minimum quality compatible with British Standard 3936:1992 (Part 1) 'Specifications For Trees & Shrubs' and British Standard 4043 (where applicable) or any subsequent revisions and BS:8545:2014 Trees: from nursery to independence in the landscape.  Any trees that within a period of 5 years from the completion of all tree planting, that die, are removed, uprooted, are significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed shall be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) with others of the same size, species and quality as approved.

The approved landscaping, play areas and boundary treatments shall be retained thereafter and maintained in accordance with the approved Estate Management Strategy (Appendix 2 of the approved Planning Statement).

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the positive visual character and appearance of the area; to ensure that the necessary boundary treatments are incorporated into the development in the interests of meeting the Secured by Design principles; in order to ensure that the site landscaping is provided in a timely fashion; and in order to provide a good level of privacy for future occupants, in accordance with policies LV2.18, LV7.3, LV7.4, 7B and 7D of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); 2.18, 7.4, 7.13, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1(h) and (i), 2.10, 5.3, 5.4 and 6.3 of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and interim SPG 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'.

| 20% of the parking spaces within the approved development shall be equipped with active charging points for electric vehicles, with an additional 20% of the parking spaces being provided with passive charging provision prior to the first occupation of the development.

Reason: In the interest of the environment and improving air quality in accordance with policies 6.13 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2015; policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(k) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and  policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| Within 6 months of the commencement of the development the details of the site-wide general security measures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall relate to:
a)	CCTV;
b)	general lighting; and/or
c)	security lighting;
d)	Measures to comply with the physical security design standards of Secured by Design.

The details shall include the location and full specification of: all lamps; light levels/spill; cameras (detailing view paths); lamps and support structures.  The external lighting scheme should be designed in accordance with ILP Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Obtrusive Light GN01:2011.

The security measures and lighting shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved, shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Reason:  To ensure that the general or security lighting and CCTV cameras are appropriately located; that the design of such measures do not adversely impact neighbouring residential amenity and are appropriate to the overall design of the building; and to ensure that the security details are appropriate and adequately secure the development in accordance with policies: 7.3; 7.4; 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and policies 7A and LV7.3 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).

| Notwithstanding the recommendations contained within the approved Environmental Noise Assessment ref: SRB/6839/A dated 13.07.2015 prepared by AIRO, further details of the noise mitigation measures for the building facades in Church Road, with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval prior to the commencement of the superstructure works. The approved details shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the development and retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the amenity of the future occupiers of the new development, in accordance with policies 3.2, 3.18 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015); policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG; and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.

| The rating noise level emitted from any proposed plant and machinery within the development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of amenity is provided for occupiers / users of the residential, education and community buildings, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016; policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration; and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

| Prior to the commencement of the development (excluding demolition, site clearance and preparation works) the following details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval:

a) An intrusive contaminated land investigation and risk assessment of the site shall be carried out in accordance with BS1075:2011+A1:2013 and CR11 guidance to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site. This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person, and shall assess any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site; and

b) A contamination remediation scheme to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended end use. It shall include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures.  The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.

c) Within six-months of the completion of measures identified in the approved contamination remediation scheme, a verification report (in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1') that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

It is acknowledged that the development will be phased and will therefore be commenced at different times. It would be acceptable for the submission of details relating to the soil contamination investigation and remediation measures to be submitted separately to reflect the construction phasing.

Reason: Further investigations of the presence of soil contamination within the application site and details of the methods for remediation are required before the commencement of building works in order to ensure that human health and the environment are protected, and to ensure the development activities do not activate or spread contamination in accordance with policies LV5.21 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policy 5.21 of the London Plan (2016), and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

| Within 6 months of the commencement of the superstructure works of the development, details of the design of the shared surface streets located to the east and west of Church Road, including details of the measures to prevent cars from parking within the shared surface streets and vehicle manoeuvring areas, and details of the pedestrian visibility splays (measuring 1.5m x 1.5m x 0.6m high) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. The shared surface streets, pedestrian visibility splays and parking areas shall be provided in accordance with the approved plans and details, and retained thereafter.

For the avoidance of doubt, no parking other than the 124 parking spaces shown on approved drawings PL-030, PL-031, ITB10202-GA-001 Rev A, ITB10202-GA-004 Rev A shall be provided within the application site.

Reason: To ensure that the parking facilities are provided in accordance with the approved details in order to prevent overspill parking in the local area; and in order that the shared surface streets and vehicle manoeuvring areas are not used for car parking in the interests of pedestrian and cyclist safety; in accordance with policies 6.9, 6.10, 6.13, 7.2 and 7.5 of the London Plan (2016).
| Ultra-Low NOx boilers with a maximum NOx Emission of <40 mgNOx/kWh shall be installed in each of the approved 13 dwellinghouses prior to the first occupation of the dwellinghouses.

The communal boiler(s) to be used to provide interim heat and hot water to the approved 133 apartments and maisonettes shall comply with the NOx (g/mÂ²) benchmarks set out at Appendix 5 of the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

Reason: To minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016; the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG; policies 1.1(e) and (j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to the final completion of all dwellings in Phase 7.1, the approved dwellings shall incorporate measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 15.64% beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 based on interim communal gas boiler solution until connection to the main Energy Centre (comprising the district-heating network within the South Acton Estate regeneration masterplan, as required by condition 41 of the extant planning permission P/2012/0708, and amended by applications ref: PP/2014/2142) where the final regulated CO2 emissions reduction of 33.6% beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 shall be achieved through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the  approved Energy Statement  dated 14 July 2015 (including additional information and amendments received 23 Sep 2015_J2059 South Acton 7.1, 30 Sep 2015_J2059 South Acton 7.1 Energy Strategy-Addendum VA, Response to Ealing Rev C2, communal areas ventilation information included in email sent in 12 October 2015, 13 Oct 2015_J2059 South Acton 7.1-Appendix-3 cases Doc, all prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd):
a)	energy saving measures to achieve at least 3.2% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over the compliant BR Part L 2013 baseline

b)	the 233 approved apartments and maisonettes shall be connected to interim communal gas boiler until such time that the development is connected to the main Energy Centre, at which time a reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of 26.4% beyond the Be Lean case shall be achieved;
c)	incorporation of solar PV technology with a total capacity of 58kWp to achieve at least a percentage of 12% in carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over the Be Clean case.
The reduction should be calculated based on carbon dioxide emissions covered by the Building Regulations Part L 2013.

Within three-months of the first occupation of the new dwellings, the Energy Performance Certificates, Accompany Advisory Reports and modelling output reports from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

Reason:  To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan (2016); policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

| Prior to the commencement of the development to construct each apartment block, (excluding demolition, site clearance and preparation works) the following details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval:

a) details of the size and layout of the plant room, the manufacturers details for the equipment and details of the flue (if applicable) for the gas boilers for the interim supply of heat and hot water to the 233 approved apartments and maisonettes, and the measures to be incorporated into the plant room to facilitate future connection to the main Energy Centre (comprising the district-heating network within the South Acton Estate regeneration masterplan, as required by condition 41 of the extant planning permission P/2012/0708, as amended);

b) a timetable for connection of the 233 approved apartments and maisonettes to the main Energy Centre (comprising the district-heating network within the South Acton Estate regeneration masterplan, as required by condition 41 of the extant planning permission P/2012/0708, as amended);

c) details of the pipe network (including network type (such as steam, high or low temp HW), flow and return temperatures, total length of the heat network in metres (flow and return) distribution and transmission, route, total plant heating capacity, total heat generated, total heat supplied to premises) for the connection of the 233 approved apartments and maisonettes to the main Energy Centre (comprising the district-heating network within the South Acton Estate regeneration masterplan, as required by condition 41 of the extant planning permission P/2012/0708, as amended).

The timetable required by sub-point (b) must comply with the requirements for connection to the main Energy Centre contained in the Deed of Modification to the S106 Agreement and condition 41 of the extant outline planning permission P/2012/0708 (and amended by applications ref: PP/2014/2142).
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To secure the measures set out within the approved Energy Statement and to ensure that the development is connected to the district heating network, and to ensure that the development contributes to reducing the use of fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity, and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases in accordance with policies 5.3, 5.5 and 5.6 of the London Plan 2015, policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policy LV5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

| The scheme of photovoltaic panels which shall provide for no less than 58kWp (equivalent to 37 tonnes CO2 emissions savings / annum), and which shall be eligible under relevant standards of the Microgeneration Certification Scheme, shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the development to which the photovoltaic panels serve.

Reason:  In the interest of sustainable development and combating climate change in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 and 5.7 of the London Plan (2016); policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); and policy LV 5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).

| The biodiversity (green and brown) roofs shall be laid out in accordance with the details shown on approved drawings (14055-PL-) E1E2-110, S1-100, W1-110, W2-110, W3-110, W4-110, HTA-110, HTB-110, HTC-110, HTD-110, unless an alternative scheme for the provision of biodiversity roofs is submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within 6 months of the commencement of the superstructure works on each phase of the development. The detailed design of the biodiversity roofs shall incorporate the following:
a) Be biodiversity based with extensive substrate base (depth 80-150mm);
b) Have sufficient depth of soil or growing medium for the relevant planting, including the re-use of any demolition material where feasible;

c) Be planted / seeded with a mix of species within the first planting season following the practical completion of the building works. The seed mix shall be focused on wildflower planting and shall contain no more than 25% sedum;
d) Have relevant efficient and effective drainage and irrigation to sustain the vegetation.

The biodiversity roofs shall not be used as an amenity or sitting out area and shall only be accessed in the case of essential maintenance or repair. The biodiversity roofs shall be retained thereafter.

Reason:  To ensure the development provides the maximum possible provision towards the creation of habitats and valuable areas for biodiversity in accordance with policies 5.3, 5.10, 5.11, 5.12 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2016); policies 1.1(j), (k) and 1.2(m) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); and policies LV5.10 and LV5.11 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).

| The development shall be designed to achieve a water use target for the residential development of no more than 105 litres per person per day, in accordance with the approved Water Statement ref: J2059 dated 14.07.2015 prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd.
Reason: To ensure the sustainable use of water, in accordance with policy 5.15 of the London Plan (2016).

| Details and samples of all facing materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any work commencing on the superstructure of the development. The samples and details shall, as far as possible, accord with the indicative details of facing materials set out at Section 9 of the approved Design and Access Statement and on the approved drawings. The details and samples of materials shall include:
a)	brickwork (including brick bond, brick panels and mortar courses);
b)	cladding materials (including roof finishes);
c)	all window treatments (including drawing to 1:20 scale showing details of the window recess);
d)	building entrances;
e)	balcony structures and balustrading treatment (including sections);
f)	privacy screen treatment;
g)	sub-station, refuse and bicycle store entrance doors and ventilation louvres;
h)	details of the design of the residential letterboxes (including confirmation that the letterboxes meet PAS 24:2012);
i)	any other materials to be used.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials are of a high-quality specification and make a positive contribution to the townscape, in accordance with policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and policies 7.1 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Storage facilities for 411 bicycles within lockable and covered stores and Sheffield stands for a minimum of 6 visitor parking spaces shall be provided for the approved development in the locations shown on approved drawings. The storage facilities shall be ready to use prior to the first occupation of any dwelling in the relevant core of the apartment building(s) and / or terraced houses (as relevant) to which the cycle parking storage serves and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1(k) and (g) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG.

| The dedicated refuse and recycling enclosures for the approved development shown on the approved drawings shall be provided prior to the first occupation of any dwelling in the relevant core of the apartment building(s) and / or terraced houses (as relevant) to which the store serves and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To secure the necessary recycling and waste enclosures to support the development and to ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and in accordance with policy 5.17 of the London Plan (2016); policy 1.1(e) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policies 7A, LV7.4 and 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); and (Interim) SPG 4: Refuse and Recyling Facilities.

| The approved residential development shall be designed and constructed to meet Approved Document M (Volume 1: Dwellings), Part M4(2)(Accessible and adaptable dwellings) of Building Regulations 2015, or other such relevant technical requirements in use at the time of the construction of the development, with the exception of Block E2.

Reason: To ensure that the development is adaptable, flexible, convenient and appropriate to the changing needs of the future occupiers, in accordance with policies 3.5, 3.8 and 3.9 of the London Plan (2016); the Mayor's SPG 'Housing' (March 2016) and policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012).

| The 5 social rent adaptable units, 2 shared ownership adaptable units and 17 private sale adaptable units, as indicated within the approved Design & Access Statement and the approved drawings, shall be designed and constr
